intro: Psychotria pariensis, commonly known as the Paria psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly found in countries like Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Psychotria pariensis is also known for its psychoactive properties due to the presence of alkaloids such as dimethyltryptamine (DMT).
